name: Hotel St. Helene

reviews.title: Truly awful!
reviews.text: (This review is a bit late because I only recently discovered this wonderful website.) My first visit to New Orleans in 2002 was ruined by the Ste-Helene Hotel experience. As the other reviewers report, it is rather disgusting. Old, dirty, a/c didn't work and lots of dripping noises. Fake advertising is the only way they get guests to come, I guess. When I first checked in, my room was so hideous and nightmarish that I went back to the reception and requested a better room. Okay, they were accommodating and did assign me another room but it was only a marginal improvement. At least it didn't look creepy, dark and gothic - but still old and filthy. Being without resources, I told myself to suck it up for the 3 nights. How much time does one spend in a hotel room. But it really does affect your mental state if you don't get any sleep over 3 nights. If I revisit, I'd want to pay more for another hotel.

reviews.title: Valentine's Weekend nightmare....
reviews.text: Basically everything you read in previous posts is correct. We stayed over Valentine's Day weekend and had a host of problems: furnace which constantly blew warm heat and didn't adequately cool the room (and I was afraid to sleep with the window open...); terrible bed (comforter had too many "unknown" stains....) and the pillows were even worse; bad t.v. reception; and and intermittenly working hairdrier. We never even tried to find the continental breakfast or happy hour, but the staff never told us it was available, either. Overall the staff was nice and helpful, but this didn't make up all of the shortcomings. In the end, you get what you pay for, and for $150 the location was great - but I would have preferred the Omni at whatever price across the street.

reviews.title: Hotel Ste. Nightmare
reviews.text: Hotel Ste. Helene should be re-named to Hotel Ste. Nightmare! My boyfriend and I vacationed in New Orleans for the first time this past December. Since this was our first trip we, of course, bought all the travel books and checked out many hotels. Hotel Ste. Helene promised to be very authentic with beautifully decorated rooms, etc, etc. We were extremely disappointed with the accomodations, the air didn't work properly and the small size of the room was ridiculous, even for two.

description: Hotel St. Helene is located on Chartres Street, right next door to the Napoleon House, a favorite among locals and tourists alike. The hotel’s location offers access to an abundance of popular attractions and world famous entertainment that the French Quarter has to offer, such as Café du Monde, the French Market, House of Blues, and Pat O’ Brien’s, which are all located within only one-half mile of this French Quarter gem! This beautifully restored hotel, just recently renovated and reopened in January 2012, is located in the heart of the French Quarter, only 2 blocks away from Bourbon Street, steps away from Jackson Square and the mighty Mississippi River. Our contemporary guest rooms and suites are complete with:-LCD flat screen TVs-Ebony stained hardwood floors-Wireless internet in guest rooms and public areas-300 thread-count linens & duvet covers-IPOD docking stations-All-marble bathrooms with standing showersOur French Quarter and Courtyard suites feature balconies which overlook the pool in the courtyard area or the historic French Quarter. All guest rooms are nicely equipped to give a feeling of being home away from home in one of the most historic cities in the world!
